triples.name: Time crystal
triples.relevance: The main subject of the review - a phase of matter with broken time translation symmetry.

triples.name: Symmetry breaking
triples.relevance: Fundamental mechanism underlying discrete time crystals through breaking of time translation symmetry.

triples.name: Many-body problem
triples.relevance: Central to understanding many-body interactions that produce time crystalline order.

triples.name: Ergodicity
triples.relevance: Ergodicity breaking is identified as key to discrete time crystals; delaying ergodicity explains time crystalline phenomena.

triples.name: Josephson effect
triples.relevance: AC Josephson effect is explicitly mentioned as sharing properties with discrete time crystals.

triples.name: Coupled map lattice
triples.relevance: A classical system exhibiting dynamics similar to discrete time crystals through spatiotemporal chaos.

triples.name: Faraday wave
triples.relevance: A classical phenomenon with properties analogous to discrete time crystals through subharmonic oscillations.

triples.name: Anderson localization
triples.relevance: One strategy for stabilizing time crystalline order through localization preventing thermalization.

triples.name: Quantum error correction
triples.relevance: Strategy for stabilizing time crystalline order in open systems through error correction mechanisms.

triples.name: Quantum simulator
triples.relevance: Experimental platform for investigating signatures of time crystalline order in quantum systems.

triples.name: Trapped-ion quantum computer
triples.relevance: Experimental platform utilizing trapped ions to study and observe discrete time crystal phenomena.

triples.name: Superconducting quantum computing
triples.relevance: Experimental platform using superconducting qubits to investigate time crystalline order.

triples.name: Spin model
triples.relevance: Solid-state spin systems are used as experimental platforms for observing discrete time crystal behavior.
